alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Columbiana; Harrison; Jefferson (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 6:13PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...GUSTY RAIN AND SNOW SHOWERS ALONG A COLD FRONT WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN CARROLL...NORTHERN HARRISON...JEFFERSON...SOUTHEASTERN COLUMBIANA...BEAVER... SOUTHEASTERN VENANGO...BUTLER...ALLEGHENY...JEFFERSON...ARMSTRONG... CLARION...SOUTHEASTERN FOREST...NORTHERN WASHINGTON...SOUTHEASTERN LAWRENCE...NORTHERN INDIANA...NORTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND...BROOKE AND HANCOCK COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM EDT... At 612 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking raind and snow showers with gusty winds along a line extending from near Wilcox to near Cadiz. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pittsburgh, Penn Hills, Mount Lebanon, Bethel Park, Ross Township, McCandless Township, Monroeville, Cranberry, Moon Township, McMurray, Weirton, and McKeesport. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 9 and 67. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 43 and 101. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 41 and 96. Parkway North between mile markers 1 and 13. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 25 and 84. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Motorists should be prepared for changeable visibility.
